_desc.NAICS_DESCRIPTION: Other Chemical and Allied Products Merchant Wholesalers
Other Chemical and Allied Products Merchant Wholesalers

_exec_summary.SummaryText:
RMP PLAN



EXECUTIVE SUMMARY



COMPANY OVERVIEW



Univar Solutions USA Inc. is a wholesale chemical distributor serving a number of U.S. industries.  Founded in 1924, Univar Solutions USA Inc. supplies the food industry, chemical compounders, pharmaceuticals, mining, forest products, oil and gas producers, electronics, coatings and many other key industries with the chemical raw materials required to produce or refine products used in numerous end-use markets.



Univar Solutions USA Inc. is a member of the National Association of Chemical Distributors (NACD) and complies with the Responsible Distribution Process (RDP), an environmental, health, and safety improvement initiative.



Some of the products stored and handled by Univar Solutions USA Inc. at this Facility are subject to EPA's Risk Management Program rule (40 CFR Part 68).  A key requirement of this rule is the preparation and submission of an RMP Plan, contained herein.  The contents of the RMP Plan are prescribed by EPA, including this Executive Summary.



CORPORATE PREVENTION AND EMERGENCY RESPONSE APPROACH



1. Prevention Program



Processes that are subject to OSHA's Process Safety management (PSM) standard AND are regulated under EPA's RMP rule are subject to the Program 3 Prevention program.  Univar Solutions USA Inc. has documented the Prevention Program in its Process Safety Management Manual.  Briefly, this program includes provisions and requirements for:



* Process Safety Information

* Process Hazard Analysis

* Operating Procedures

* Training

* Mechanical Integrity

* Management of Change

* Pre-Startup Review

* Compliance Audits

* Incident Investigation

* Employee Participation

* Hot Work permits

* Contractors



2. Emergency Response Approach



Univar Solutions USA Inc. has an Emergency Contingency Plan in place.  This Plan is shared with local emergency responders who have access to Univar Solutions USA Inc. facility personnel.  Univar Solutions USA Inc. responds to minor

incidents but will call in professional emergency responders in the event of non-minor incidents.



Univar Solutions USA Inc. invites and encourages local emergency responders such as the fire department to visit and familiarize themselves with Univar Solutions USA Inc. products and facilities.  Joint emergency exercises are conducted with the Dauphin County HazMat Response Team on an approximate quarterly basis.





STATIONARY SOURCE



The Middletown Pennsylvania site stores, handles, and delivers a variety of hazardous and non-hazardous chemical products to wholesale customers in Pennsylvania, West Virginia, Maryland and New York. Chlorine and Sulfur Dioxide are handled at the facility at inventory levels above the threshold planning quantity.  Anhydrous ammonia and formaldehyde solution may be handled at the facility at inventory levels above the threshold planning quantity (these two chemicals are predictive filing chemicals).





GENERAL PREVENTION PROGRAM AND CHEMICAL-SPECIFIC PREVENTION STEPS



As outlined previously, Univar Solutions USA Inc. is subject to OSHA's Process Safety Management regulation and utilizes this program to meet the prevention program requirements under RMP.



Chemical-specific prevention steps include the following:

1.The maintenance of minimal practical inventories.

2. Employee training and operating procedures.

3. Employee release detection and mitigation activities.

4. Equipment and containers designed to meet appropriate regulatory guidelines  



ACCIDENT HISTORY



The site has experienced no accidents as specified in 40 CFR Part 68 related to the handling of chlorine, sulfur dioxide, formaldehyde solution, or anhydrous ammonia in the previous 5 years before this resubmission.



EMERGENCY RESPONSE PROGRAM



An emergency contingency plan has been prepared and made available to local emergency response agencies. Dauphin County Emergency Planning Committee is the Local Emergency Planning Committee (LEPC) with which our em

ergency plan has been coordinated and verified.  Arrangements have been formalized with emergency response contractor Environmental Products & Services Inc. to provide on site and off site emergency response services in the event of a release.



Joint emergency exercises are conducted with the Dauphin County HazMat Response Team on an approximate quarterly basis.



PLANNED CHANGES TO IMPROVE SAFETY

At this time, the facility does not have specific plans to improve safety. However, we are continuously evaluating our processes and will implement any safety improvements as appropriate.



REVISIONS

This RMP Plan was submitted as a correction on May 24, 2021. The reason for correction was to update the emergency contact in Section 1 and this Executive Summary due to a change in facility management.

This RMP Plan was recertified on 9/10/2021 to remove formaldehyde as a covered process due to removal of the chemical from the facility due to loss of customer orders.
